/generate.description: Generate new code from a description
examples: /generate write a function that sorts a list
/generate write a function to validate email addresses

/tools.description: List all available tools organized by type, or filter by category

/tool.description: Show detailed YAML documentation for a tool, or manage tools

subcommands.info <tool_id>: Show detailed information about a tool
subcommands.<tool_id>: Show full YAML documentation with examples, parameters, and usage
subcommands.reload: Reload tools from disk and RAG

/status.description: Show system status including Ollama connection, models, and configuration

/clear_rag.description: Clear ALL RAG memory including non-YAML tool definitions (WARNING: destructive!)
/clear_rag.warning: This will delete all dynamically generated tools, code artifacts, plans, and workflows stored in RAG memory. YAML-based tools will be preserved.

/help.description: Show help message with all available commands

/manual.description: Search the manual for commands and help. Uses intelligent fuzzy matching.

/auto.description: Enable or disable auto-evolution of code

/evolve.description: Manually trigger evolution for a specific node

tools.description: Reusable components that can be invoked to perform specific tasks. Tools can be LLM-based (use language models) or executable (run code).

rag.description: RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) memory system stores code artifacts, plans, workflows, and tools for semantic search and reuse.

evolution.description: Automatic code improvement system that monitors performance and generates improved versions when code underperforms.

tiers.description: Model tier system with tier_1 (fast), tier_2 (standard), tier_3 (god-level) for coding, content, and analysis tasks.
